h2_title: Green-Capped Martialist Boss Fight and Guide
img_above_text:
# Green-Capped Martialist

The Green-Capped Martialist is an optional and secret Character Boss fight that you can encounter in Chapter 3 of Black Myth Wukong. This boss can only be fought by undertaking a Treasure Hunter's Quest that begins along the Bitter Lake and leads to the Valley of Ecstasy, where you'll have to uncover a secret Melon Field.

* Rewards: Spell-Binder Spell, Cold Iron Leaves, Random Materials, 1847 Experience, 1190 Will


As you approach, the Treasure Hunter will reveal his true form and attack!

## Green-Capped Martialist Boss Fight and Guide

A second part of this attack will trigger a ring of projectiles around his chakram to zoom toward you, which you'll need to also dodge shortly after the first blast.
img_below_text: When this boss chooses to close the distance on you, he'll employ some deceitful moves, like tossing his chakram to the side of your position, making you think he's going to miss, or tossing it in an arc. In reality, he'll dash up to it and then grab it to swing in a large arc toward your position, creating a second chakram for a two-hit combo.

Preceding Text Summary:
The Green-Capped Martialist is a secret optional boss in *Black Myth: Wukong*, encountered during Chapter 3 as part of a Treasure Hunter's Quest. The quest involves uncovering a hidden Melon Field in the Valley of Ecstasy. Upon approach, the Treasure Hunter reveals his true form and initiates combat. Rewards for defeating this boss include items, materials, experience points, and a spell.

Following Text Summary:
The Green-Capped Martialist employs deceptive close-range tactics, such as throwing his chakram in misleading trajectories to trick the player. He then dashes to retrieve the chakram, executing a two-hit combo with a second chakram swing. Players must anticipate and adapt to these unpredictable moves during the fight.
